result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio D Foreman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.  Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 08-24-2016 or, convert to a civil judgment.

*With credit for 2 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
*Court will grant expungement after 1 year if the defendant commits no new crimes.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio D Foreman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court will grant expungement after 1 year if the defendant commits no new crimes.

Defendant Antonio D Foreman in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.  Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 08-24-2016 or, convert to a civil judgment.  Court will grant expungement after 1 year if the defendant commits no new crimes.  Appeal rights given.

Jury trial scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio D Foreman in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Antonio D Foreman in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on September 9, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Antonio D Foreman in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Defense is in receipt of discovery.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
$400.00 bail to be returned. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio D Foreman in court.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
